docblock.long-description:
Provides a content box which contains content which is panned left and right through a viewport by sliding a knob horizontally

 

Usage:

  [tdr_framework_sliderknob notched="{true|false}"][slider]Content pane for first entry[/slider][slider]Content pane for second entry[/slider][/tdr_framework_sliderknob]

docblock.description: Registers all necessary scripts used for sliderknob so WordPress knows about them. Triggered on WordPress's "wp_enqueue_scripts" event.

Conditionally loads all necessary scripts used for sliderknob based on the type of sliderknob used (notched vs unnotched) and if there are any sliders present or not. Triggered on WordPress's "wp_footer" event.

tag.name: var
tag.description: Global variable stating whether to load slider scripts

tag.name: var
tag.description: Global variable array listing which types of sliders are present on the page, if any

docblock.description: Defines the behavior of the "tdr_framework_sliderknob" shortcode. Triggered by regular WordPress add_shortcode() function.

tag.name: var
tag.description: Global variable stating whether to load slider scripts

tag.name: var
tag.description: Global variable array listing which types of sliders are present on the page, if any

tag.name: var
tag.description: A counter for the number of sliders on the page

tag.name: var
tag.description: An array containing the content of individual slider content-panes

tag.name: var
tag.description: Contains the content panes for each sliderknob instance

tag.name: return
tag.description: Contains all content of the sliderknob instance, including individual content-panes and the sliderknob itself

docblock.description: Defines the behavior of the "slider" shortcode. Triggered by regular WordPress add_shortcode() function.

tag.name: var
tag.description: A counter for the number of sliders on the page

tag.name: var
tag.description: An array containing the content of individual slider content-panes. Values are pushed to the array each time this function is triggered.
